metadata.title: Effect of the nano-hybrid pour point depressants on the cold flow properties of diesel fuel

sections.text:
Contents lists available at ScienceDirect
Fuel
journal homepage: www.elsevier .com/locate / fuel
Full Length Article
Effect of the nano-hybrid pour point depressants on the cold flow properties of diesel fuel
http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.fuel.2016.12.020 0016-2361/ 2016 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
⇑ Corresponding authors. E-mail addresses: hansheng654321@sina.com (S. Han), lhl6534@163.com
(H. Lin).
Zhicheng Zhao, Yuan Xue, Guangwen Xu, Jiawei Zhou, Xiang Lian, Ping Liu, Daming Chen, Sheng Han ⇑, Hualin Lin ⇑ School of Chemical and Environmental Engineering, Shanghai Institute of Technology, Shanghai 201418, China
h i g h l i g h t s
The nano-hybrid PPDs exhibit better reduction effects on the CFPP of diesel than the pure PPD. The CFPP and SP of diesel decreased with the addition of nano-hybrid PPDs. 0.15 wt.% nano-hybrid PMA (4:1) treated diesel exhibit the highest depression effect. The performance mechanism of nano-hybrid PMA on 0# diesel was determined.
a r t i c l e i n f o
Article history: Received 5 August 2016 Received in revised form 26 November 2016 Accepted 7 December 2016
Keywords: Nano-hybrid Pour point depressants Cold flow properties Diesel Nano-clay
a b s t r a c t
The nano-hybrid pour point depressants (PPDs) was prepared by organically modified nano-clay covering in polymeric PPDs, namely, polymethyl acrylate (PMA), ethylene vinyl acetate copolymer and poly-aolefin. The effects of nano-hybrid PPDs on the cold flow properties of diesel fuel were evaluated. The crystal morphology and crystallization behavior of the diesel fuels in low-temperature were also observed by polarizing optical microscopy (POM) and differential scanning calorimetry (DSC). The results indicated that the nano-hybrid PPDs always exhibited a better cold filter plugging point, while it had little effect on solidifying point compared to pure PPDs, and PMA hybrid with organically modified nano-clay in mass ratio of 4:1 exerted the best depression effect. Up addition of 0.15 wt.% nano-hybrid PMA (4:1) in diesel, the cold filter plugging point and solidifying point were reduced by 16 C and 14 C, respectively. DSC and POM results showed that the nano-hybrid PMA involved heterogeneous nucleation activity. The nanohybrid PMA modified the crystallization behavior of diesel by transforming the shape of wax crystals and inhibiting the formation of larger crystals, which result in compact, regular, tiny particle-shaped and uniform arrangement wax morphologies.
2016 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

sections.heading: 1. Introduction
sections.text:
Diesel fuels derived from petroleum contain large proportion of n-paraffin waxes [1]. Under cold climates or low-temperature conditions, the diesel fuels are easy to crystallize, precipitate and form a three-dimensional network structure, thereby blocking the engine pipes and filters [2]. Therefore, the poor cold flow properties will certainly be the resistance of the efficient use of diesel fuels [3].
To solve this issue, adding pour point depressants (PPDs) have proved to be one of the economic and effective methods to lower the cold filter plugging point (CFPP) and solidifying point (SP) of diesel fuels. Also, various kinds of polymers have been investigated
and used as PPDs to improve the cold flow properties of diesel fuel. The frequently-used PPDs for diesel fuel mainly include alkyl methacrylate copolymers [4–6], poly(vinyl acetate)copolymers [7–9] and poly (olefin) copolymers [10]. Although these polymeric PPDs have certain positive effect on lowering the CFPP and SP of diesel fuel, it still needs to be further studied in order to achieve a better depression effect.
With the continuous development of nano-technology in recent years, nano-materials have been widely applied in industry [11–14]. Polymer/inorganic nanocomposites or nano-hybrid materials have become a hotspot in scientific research, especially polymer/inorganic nanocomposites, which are composed of inorganic nanoparticles into polymer matrixes. In the field of improving rheological properties of crude oil, nano-hybrid PPDs are becoming a new research focus. Wang et al. [15] have prepared a nano-hybrid PPD and compared rheology performance efficiencies
Nomenclature
PPDs pour point depressants CFPP cold filter plugging pointand SP solidifying point EVA ethylene vinyl acetate POA polyoctadecylacrylate MOAS olefins and styrene
PMA polymethyl acrylate EVAC ethylene vinyl acetate copolymer PAO poly-a-olefin POM polarizing optical microscopy DSC differential scanning calorimetry CTMAB hexadecyl trimethyl ammonium bromide
between nano-hybrid PPD and traditional ethylene vinyl acetate (EVA) PPD. Nano-hybrid PPDs had a better pour point depression effect than the corresponding EVA. Yang et al. [16] have developed a nano-hybrid PPD by making hydrophilic nano-silica into poly (octadecyl acrylate) POA PPD. Rheological results showed that nano-hybrid POA could further decrease viscosity, gelation point and yield stress of a model waxy oils compared to the pure PPD. Yao et al. [17] have prepared a nano-hybrid PPD by solvent blend method that dispersed organic nano-clay into polyoctadecylacrylate (POA). Compared with the same standard of POA, the adding of POA/clay nanocomposite PPD could effectively change the rheological properties of crude oil, such as viscosity, gelation point and yield stress. Polarizing microscopy images of precipitated wax crystals showed that POA/clay nanocomposites PPD provided wax nucleation sites upon which wax molecules assemble and precipitate. Therefore, the nano-hybrid PPDs can effectively improve the rheological properties of crude oil.
Many studies also have been reported on the effect of various polymeric PPDs on the cold flow properties of diesel fuel [18– 21]. For example, Soldi et al. [22] have developed in this study for the synthesis of methacrylic monomers to study the cold flow properties of diesel. In the pour point tests that were conducted with various samples of methacrylic copolymers, the SP and CFPP decreased by 4 C and 3 C adding methacrylic copolymers at 0.05 wt.%; Song et al. [1] have studied the relationship between the structure and activities of alkyl methacrylate-maleic anhydride polymers as cold flow improvers in diesel fuel. All of the tested copolymers and terpolymers could not obviously improve the cold filter plugging point depressing performance of diesel fuel; Li et al. [23] have introduced the synthesis of mixed alcohols esterified copolymer of maleic anhydride with acrylic alkyl ester, olefins and styrene (MOAS) as pour point depressant for diesel. By adding the MOAS with 0.07 wt.%, the pour point and cold filter plugging point decreased by 6 C and 4 C. However, the effect of nanohybrid PPDs as a cold flow improver in diesel fuel has not yet been studied. Hence, three kinds of representative commercial polymeric PPDs, namely, polymethyl acrylate (PMA), ethylene vinyl acetate copolymer (EVAC) and poly-a-olefin (PAO) were selected for analysis in this study. It will be beneficial for the utilization of traditional cold flow improvers and instructs the further development of a new effective diesel PPDs.
In this work, organic nano-clay was prepared and nano-hybrid PAO, EVAC, and PMA were made by solvent blending method. The effect of various nano-hybrid PPDs on the cold flow properties of diesel were comparative studied. Finally, the crystallization behavior and crystal morphology of diesel with nano-hybrid PPDs treated were observed by using the polarized optical microscopy (POM) and differential scanning calorimetry (DSC).

sections.heading: 2.1. Materials
sections.text:
Songjiang 0# diesel, a light diesel fuel grade meeting the requirements of the GB252 specification in the Chinese market,
was obtained from the Shanghai SongJiang gas station (one of the point-of-sale of Sinopec Group, Shanghai). The three polymeric PPDs, namely, T803 (PAO), T-1804D (EVAC) and T-602 (PMA), were obtained from Shanghai Antai Chemicals Co. Ltd. (China), Rohmax Corporation of Germany, and Shanghai Hailian Lubricating Material Technology Co. Ltd., (China), respectively. Nano-clay, toluene and hexadecyl trimethyl ammonium bromide (CTMAB) were purchased from Tansoole Reagent Co., Ltd. (China).

sections.heading: 2.2. Composition of diesel fuels
sections.text: The physicochemical characteristics of 0# diesel were given in Table 1. The compositions and purity of 0# diesel were determined by Shimadzu GC–MS QP2010SE. An HP-88 column (30 m 0.25 mm 0.25 lm) was used. The capillary column temperature was increased from 60 C to 160 C (5 C/min) then from 160 C to 230 C (5 C/min). Both injector and interface temperatures were 260 C, and a high-purity helium carrier (1 mL/min, 100:1) was used. The compositions of the diesel were given in Fig. 1. The number of carbon atoms in 0# diesel fuel was broadly distributed (C9-C25), and the average carbon number of n-paraffin was 16.5. The diesel fuel included 68.42 wt.% of n-paraffin, which was easy to form a three-dimensional network structure. The results showed that the cold flow properties of 0# diesel, which had high content of wax that could not be easily improved. In addition, the cold flow properties of 0# diesel can be improved by adding the traditional PPDs, but it always cannot be achieved the desired effects [1–4,19]. Thus, nano-hybrid PPDs were used to further enhance the depression effective of the ordinary PPDs.

sections.heading: 2.3. Preparation of organic nano-clay
sections.text:
Organic nano-clay was prepared by using cationic exchange modified nano-clay, and the addition amount of CTMAB was 1.5 times of the nano-clay [33–35]. The nano-clay was first dissolved in deionized water to form a suspension solution and heated up to 80 C. Then, adding the toluene solution and continued stirring for 5 h. White sediments were centrifugal with deionized water until it used AgNO3 to detect without Cl . Finally, organic nanoclay was prepared by vacuum drying of sediment and ground to
5000 mesh. The compositions of the original and organic nano-clay were characterized with FT-IR spectrometry in a Bio-Rad Excalibur Series FTS-3500GX system.

sections.heading: 2.4. Preparation of nano-hybrid PPD
sections.text:
According to previous studies [15–17,36,37], nano-hybrid PMA, EVAC and PAO were prepared by toluene solvent blending [16]. A
Fig. 3. Different mass ratio of nano-hybrid PMA with a concentration of 0.15
certain amount of polymeric PPDs was first dissolved in toluene; subsequently, a certain proportion of nano-clay was dispersed in the polymeric PPDs/toluene solution though ultrasonic treatment and vigorous stirring. The solution was carefully evaporated at 130 C under continuous stirring to remove the toluene. Finally, the nano-hybrid PPDs were prepared. The PMA, EVAC and PAO/ organically modified nano-clay mass ratio was retained at 1:1, 2:1, 4:1, 8:1 in order to explore the effect of different mass ratio of nano-hybrid PPDs on the cold flow properties of diesel.
Diesel was mixed with the nano-hybrid PPDs at the mass percentages of 0.03%, 0.05%, 0.07%, 0.1%, 0.15% and 0.2%. The formulated diesel fuels were kept at a 300 rpm stirred speed and 50– 55 C temperatures for 30 min, making sure the PPDs distributed evenly in the diesel fuel.

sections.heading: 2.5. Cold flow properties measurements
sections.text: Cold flow properties are the most important index to evaluate diesel fuel, such as CFPP and SP [38–40]. CFPP is the highest temperature which a certain amount of sample diesel cannot through the standardized wire mesh filter within a specified time [41,42]. SP is the highest temperature at which the diesel samples lose its fluidity [40]. In addition, the SP and CFPP of diesel samples were determinated according to the standards of GB 19147 [28], and ASTM D2500 [27], respectively. Furthermore, all the experimental data have been tested three times according to the standard test method, and taken the average value in order to accurately describe the experimental phenomena.

sections.heading: 2.6. Crystal morphology and crystallization behavior observation
sections.text:
A DM2500P polarizing optical microscopy (Leica, Germany) was used to observe the wax crystals morphology of diesel samples at a given cooling rate of 0.8 C/min, and the micrograph was took at 1 C intervals under a 100 magnification.
DSC (model Q2000, TA Instruments, America) curve was used to analyze the diesel and diesel samples under the following conditions: samples of 8–10 mg were placed in standard crucibles. Transition temperatures and enthalpies were determined by computer during the heating cycle at a scanning rate of 5 C/min and temperature ranging from 30 C to 60 C.

sections.heading: 3.1. Characteristics of organic nano-clay
sections.text:
FT-IR spectra of original and organic nano-clay are presented in Fig. 2. The original nano-clay spectrum displays characteristic
wt.% dispersed in dodecane after 1 h: (a) 1:1, (b) 2:1, (c) 4:1, and (d) 8:1.
absorption peaks appeared at 802 (SiO2 stretching), 1100 cm 1 (SiAOASi antisymmetric stretching vibration peak), 3446– 3620 cm 1 (RAOAH stretching), respectively. Additionally, organic nano-clay characteristic absorption peaks appeared at 1475 cm 1 (CAH flexural vibration peak, 2850–2919 cm 1 (CAH stretching vibration peak). Above fully proved that nano-clay had been successfully organically modified by cationic modification [43,44].

sections.heading: 3.2. Characteristics of nano-hybrid PPD
sections.text:
In order to explore whether the nano-hybrid PPDs have a good dispersion in 0# diesel, it was crucial to make a simulation experiment with dodecane solvent instead of 0# diesel for getting more clear and intuitive observation. Hence, the nano-hybrid PMA with
Fig. 4. DCFPP and DSP of diesel fuel treated with three nano-hybrid PPDs: (a and
a concentration of 0.15 wt.% was dispersed in dodecane solvent and placed at room temperature for 1.0 h.
As shown in Fig. 3, the nano-hybrid PMA of 1:1, 2:1, 4:1, 8:1 have certain turbidity, and no evident sedimentation observed after 1.0 h standing for all different ratio of nano-hybrid PMA in dodecane solution. It indicates that nano-hybrid PMA have a good dispersion in dodecane solvent, consistent with an oleophilic nature. Hence, nano-hybrid PMA can be well distributed in diesel fuel.

sections.heading: 3.3. Effect of nano-hybrid PPDs on cold flow properties of diesel
sections.text:
Effects of the three polymeric PPDs and nano-hybrid PPDs on the cold flow properties of diesel are determined, and the depression of CFPP and SP (DCFPP and DSP) of diesel fuel before and after
b) nano-hybrid PAO; (c and d) nano-hybrid EVAC; (e and f) nano-hybrid PMA.
treated with PPDs are shown in Fig. 4. DCFPP refers to the reduced extent of the traditional PPDs or nano-hybrid PPDs at various dosages to cold filter plugging point; DSP refers to the reduced extent of the traditional PPDs or nano-hybrid PPDs at various dosages to solidifying point.
As shown in Fig. 4, pure or nano-hybrid PAO, EVAC and PMA exerts different effects on DCFPP and DSP. With the increase of PPDs in diesel, the DCFPP and DSP increases firstly, and then start to level off or decrease. The effects of the nano-hybrid PPDs on DCFPP and DSP sometimes are inconsistent, because SP is closely related to the formation of three-dimensional network, while CFPP is directly related to the size, shape and aggregation of the wax crystals [39]. Compared with the three pure polymeric PPDs, the corresponding nano-hybrid PPDs exhibit better reduction effects on the CFPP and SP of diesel and the values ofDCFPP are higher than that of DSP. However, the nano-hybrid PPDs is prepared by organically modified nano-clay covering in polymeric PPDs. Different nano-hybrid PPDs in variousmass ratio exhibit different depression effects on the CFPP and SP of diesel fuel. Among of which, PPDs hybrid with organically modified nano-clay in mass ratio of 4:1 has the best depression performance, especially the nano-hybrid PMA. The DCFPP and DSP of nano-hybrid PMA treated diesel presents the highest values, indicating that the nano-hybrid PMA is the most effective cold flow improver among of the three nanohybrid PPDs. However, there is a special phenomenon in Fig. 4f. The slope corresponded to the ratio (1:0) is a little confusing and its value is the smallest one at the 0.03 wt.% dosage. In contrast, it is higher than the others at the 0.05 wt.% dosage. This is mainly because of the different sensitive to 0# diesel and heterogeneous nucleation. More specifically, at the 0.03 wt.% dosage, pure PMA PPDs (1:0) has a poor sensitive to 0# diesel. On the contrary, due to heterogeneous nucleation, other proportions of nano-hybrid PMA have nano-clay particles which acted as a nucleation point that caused wax crystallization. It hindered and suppressed the formation of larger wax crystals, and then formed compact particleshaped and uniform arrangement wax crystals. Hence, the value is the smallest at the 0.03 wt.% dosage. However, when the dosage of nano-hybrid PMA at 0.05 wt.%, pure PMA PPDs (1:0) has become more and more sensitive to 0# diesel as the dosage continues to increase. Thus, it is higher than the others at the 0.05 wt.% dosage.
As it can be seen from Fig. 4e and f, as the dosage of nano-hybrid PMA (4:1) increase from 0.03 wt.% to 0.2 wt.%, the DCFPP and DSP increase first, and then remain constantly. Up addition of 0.15 wt.% nano-hybrid PMA (4:1) in diesel, theDCFPP andDSP reach its maximum, which is 16 C and 14 C, respectively. Therefore, 0.15 wt.% nano-hybrid PMA (4:1) is more sensitive to the diesel fuel, and the 0.15 wt.% nano-hybrid PMA (4:1) treated diesel presents the best cold flow properties. In addition, the three nano-hybrid PPDs have the beneficial effect on CFPP. However, it has little effect for improving the SP. The reasons are as follows: firstly, CFPP refers to the highest temperature where a specified volume of sample oil is no longer filter through the standardized wire mesh filter within a prescribed time limit [37,38]. As the nano-hybrid PPDs add to the diesel, the wax crystals turn into small particleshaped, so it delays the formation of three-dimensional network structure and large wax crystals of these particles and makes these small particles pass through the standardized wire mesh filter, therefore, the nano-hybrid PPDs has a good effect on CFPP [39,42]. Secondly, SP is the highest temperature at which no movement of the test specimen is observed under the prescribed conditions of the test according to GB 19147. However, although the sizes of the wax crystals are very small, the number of wax crystals are relatively increased compared to the conventional PPDs [16,17]. These small wax crystals gather to form a threedimensional network structure with the reduction of temperature once again, which led to the wax crystals cannot be filtered
through the standardized wire mesh filter, so the nano-hybrid PPDs doesn’t have a good effect on SP [16–18].

sections.heading: 3.4.1. DSC analysis
sections.text:
DSC, as an effective technology, has been used to quantitatively analyze the energy changes in the phase change process of diesel samples [45–47]. Pure diesel, diesel treated with PMA and nanohybrid PMA (4:1) are determined by DSC. The DSC curves and data analysis are depicted in Fig. 5 and Table 2, respectively.
As shown in Fig. 5 and Table 2, the vertical axis represents the heat flow rate, and the horizontal axis represents the temperature in DSC curves [41,42,45,48,49]. The starting temperature of the peak (onset) in the curves indicates the temperature in which the wax crystals in the diesel samples start to precipitate, and the slope of the peak reflects the rate of the wax crystals precipitation in diesel. In addition, the solid-liquid phase change energy (DH) reveals the stability of dispersion. The starting temperature of the peak of diesel with nano-hybrid PMA (4:1) (onset) is 5.64 C, which is slightly higher than that of diesel with PMA ( 6.31 C) and pure diesel ( 6.65 C). The peak temperatures (peak) are raised systematically from 7.91 C and 6.82 C to 5.97 C in the same order. These results indicate that nanohybrid PMA (4:1) raises the temperature of crystal formation. The reason for this phenomenon is that the presence of organic nano-clay promotes wax crystals nucleation by providing heterogeneous nucleation sites [16,50]. The absolute value ofDH of diesel with nano-hybrid PMA (4:1) is 12.73 mJ, which is lower than that of pure diesel (14.18 mJ) and diesel with PMA (13.19 mJ), indicating that the dispersion becomes more stable after adding nanohybrid PMA (4:1) into the diesel fuel. However, nano-hybrid PMA (4:1) essentially has no effect on the slope of the peak, which does not change the rate of precipitation of wax crystals. Additionally, the peak area of diesel with nano-hybrid PMA (4:1) also has no
significant change compared with other samples, indicating that the number of wax crystals remain essentially constant. All of the above factors lead to the further improvement of the cold flow properties of diesel effectively.

sections.heading: 3.4.2. POM analysis
sections.text:
Fig. 6 shows the morphology of wax crystals in pure diesel, diesel treated with 0.15 wt.% PMA and nano-hybrid PMA (4:1) at 10 C and 20 C, respectively. Wax crystals reflect polarized light and exhibit bright white images. In addition, because of amorphous substances absorb light, results in black images [51–53].
As shown in Fig. 6, shape, amount and size varies across different wax crystals in diesel. In pure diesel, wax crystals are rapidly to crystallize, precipitate, and eventually form the strip-shaped wax crystals with the three-dimensional network structure as the temperature decreased from 10 C to 20 C, thus losing the fluidity (Fig. 6A and D). The diesel with PMA at 10 C shows that some observable small particle-shaped wax crystals formed (Fig. 6B). At 20 C, a large amount of small particle-shaped wax crystals are growing (Fig. 6E). However, at 10 C and 20 C, the distribution of wax crystals is not compact, regular, and the size is different. Due to the uneven distribution of the wax crystals, some wax crystals are easily assembled together, thus forming a threedimensional network structure and losing the fluidity again. The diesel with nano-hybrid PMA (4:1) at 10 C shows the formation of few fine grains of wax crystals, presenting a compact and uniform arrangement structure (Fig. 6C). At 20 C, it forms a large number of particle-shaped wax crystals with compact, regular, and uniform arrangement (Fig. 6F). Compared with the dosages of an equal amount of PMA, this wax crystals are more compact and neat, which make more liquid diesel fuel released from three-dimensional networks.
As shown in Fig. 6C and F, the crystallization behavior and morphology of wax crystals are modified by nano-hybrid PMA (4:1), which hinders the formation of larger wax crystals and forms compact, regular, and uniform arrangement particle-shaped wax crystals. The above phenomenon can be explained as follows: on the one hand, the nano-hybrid PMA (4:1) provides a heterogeneous nucleation sites for wax crystallization [16]. The nano-clay particles act as a nucleation point that causes wax crystallization. Moreover, the crystallization behavior and morphology of wax crystals
are modified by nano-hybrid PMA (4:1), which hinders and suppresses the formation of larger wax crystals, and forms compact particle-shaped and uniform arrangement wax crystals. The compact particle-shaped and small sizes of wax crystals are adverse to the three-dimensional network structure, thus improving the cold flow properties of diesel further. On the other hand, the nano-clay has high surface energy, so the wax crystals must tend to be more compact arrangement of way to reduce the interfacial area and the surface energy in order to maintain a stable energy system when nano-hybrid PMA (4:1) is added to diesel fuel [54]. Many of the encapsulated liquid diesel are released from the three-dimensional network of wax crystals, which greatly reduce the wax-oil interfacial area, thus the cold flow properties of diesel is improved.

sections.heading: 4. Conclusions
sections.text:
The nano-hybrid PPDs in general appears to have a beneficial effect on the CFPP value but not on the SP value compared with the conventional PPDs. PPDs hybrid with organically modified nano-clay in mass ratio of 4:1 exerted better depression effects. Among of them, nano-hybrid PMA (4:1) is the best cold flow improver for diesel. 0.15 wt.% nano-hybrid PMA (4:1) treated diesel exhibit the highest depression on the CFPP and SP of diesel by 16 and 14 C, respectively.
DSC analysis showed that diesel with nano-hybrid PMA (4:1) had an earlier crystallization temperature and the number of wax crystals remained essentially constant. Moreover, it performed as heterogeneous nucleation sites for wax crystals and refined the wax crystal particles. POM analysis showed that the crystal shape and size were modified by nano-hybrid PMA (4:1). The wax crystals became more compact, regular, uniform arrangement; more tiny particle-shaped and more liquid contents were released from three-dimensional network. Thus, the nano-hybrid PMA (4:1) treated exerts the better cold flow ability.

sections.text:

referenceMentions.context: Diesel fuels derived from petroleum contain large proportion of n-paraffin waxes [1].

Under cold climates or low-temperature conditions, the diesel fuels are easy to crystallize, precipitate and form a three-dimensional network structure, thereby blocking the engine pipes and filters [2].
Therefore, the poor cold flow properties will certainly be the resistance of the efficient use of diesel fuels [3].
The frequently-used PPDs for diesel fuel mainly include alkyl methacrylate copolymers [4–6], poly(vinyl acetate)copolymers [7–9] and poly (olefin) copolymers [10].

The effects of the nano-hybrid PPDs on DCFPP and DSP sometimes are inconsistent, because SP is closely related to the formation of three-dimensional network, while CFPP is directly related to the size, shape and aggregation of the wax crystals [39].

As the nano-hybrid PPDs add to the diesel, the wax crystals turn into small particleshaped, so it delays the formation of three-dimensional network structure and large wax crystals of these particles and makes these small particles pass through the standardized wire mesh filter, therefore, the nano-hybrid PPDs has a good effect on CFPP [39,42].

metadata.abstractText: The nano-hybrid pour point depressants (PPDs) was prepared by organically modified nano-clay covering in polymeric PPDs, namely, polymethyl acrylate (PMA), ethylene vinyl acetate copolymer and poly-aolefin. The effects of nano-hybrid PPDs on the cold flow properties of diesel fuel were evaluated. The crystal morphology and crystallization behavior of the diesel fuels in low-temperature were also observed by polarizing optical microscopy (POM) and differential scanning calorimetry (DSC). The results indicated that the nano-hybrid PPDs always exhibited a better cold filter plugging point, while it had little effect on solidifying point compared to pure PPDs, and PMA hybrid with organically modified nano-clay in mass ratio of 4:1 exerted the best depression effect. Up addition of 0.15 wt.% nano-hybrid PMA (4:1) in diesel, the cold filter plugging point and solidifying point were reduced by 16 C and 14 C, respectively. DSC and POM results showed that the nano-hybrid PMA involved heterogeneous nucleation activity. The nanohybrid PMA modified the crystallization behavior of diesel by transforming the shape of wax crystals and inhibiting the formation of larger crystals, which result in compact, regular, tiny particle-shaped and uniform arrangement wax morphologies. 2016 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
